title: Add linting and formatting tools (Prettier, ESLint, oxlint)
Install and configure Prettier
description: Install prettier as dev dependency and create .prettierrc config file with project formatting rules. Add .prettierignore to exclude generated files, node_modules, and build outputs.

title: Install and configure ESLint
description: Install eslint and necessary plugins (@typescript-eslint/parser, @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin, eslint-plugin-vue for Nuxt). Create eslint.config.ts (flat config) with TypeScript and Vue support. Configure rules for code quality.

title: Install and configure oxlint with eslint-plugin-oxlint
description: Install oxlint and eslint-plugin-oxlint. Add oxlint to eslint.config.ts using oxlint.configs['flat/recommended'] to turn off ESLint rules already covered by oxlint. This allows running oxlint first for fast feedback, then ESLint for remaining checks.

title: Add lint and format scripts to package.json
description: Add scripts: 'lint' (run oxlint then eslint), 'lint:fix' (auto-fix issues), 'format' (run prettier), 'format:check' (check formatting without fixing). Configure lint script to run oxlint before eslint for faster feedback loop.

title: Add pre-commit hooks with lint-staged
description: Install husky and lint-staged. Configure pre-commit hook to run oxlint and prettier on staged files. This ensures code quality before commits. Add lint-staged config to package.json targeting .js, .ts, .vue files.

title: Download and cache movie posters locally
Create /public/posters directory structure
description: Create /public/posters directory to store downloaded movie poster images. Add .gitkeep file to track the directory. Update .gitignore to exclude poster images (*.jpg, *.png) but keep the directory structure.

title: Create poster download script
description: Create scripts/download-posters.ts that downloads poster images from metadata.Poster URLs and saves them to /public/posters/[imdbId].jpg. Features: parallel downloads with rate limiting, retry logic for failed downloads, progress tracking, skip already downloaded posters, handle both .jpg and .png formats, validate image downloads, generate download report with success/failure stats.

title: Add image download utilities
description: Create scripts/utils/imageDownloader.ts with utilities for downloading and validating images. Include: downloadImage(url, filepath) function with timeout and retry logic, validateImage() to check file integrity, getImageFormat() to detect jpg/png/webp, resizeImage() for optional optimization, error handling for network failures and invalid images.

title: Add download-posters CLI command to package.json
description: Add 'download-posters' script to package.json that runs the poster download script. Support options: --force (re-download existing), --limit N (download only N posters for testing), --concurrency N (parallel downloads), --dry-run (show what would be downloaded). Example: pnpm download-posters --limit 10 --dry-run

title: Add poster fallback logic to movie store
description: Update app/stores/useMovieStore.ts to add getPosterUrl(imdbId) helper that returns local poster path if exists (/posters/[imdbId].jpg), otherwise falls back to metadata.Poster URL, or returns placeholder image if neither exists. Add posterExists(imdbId) check and preloadPosters() method for batch loading.

title: Document poster download workflow in README
description: Add section to README.md explaining the poster caching system: why posters are cached locally (performance, offline support, CDN reliability), how to download posters (pnpm download-posters), where posters are stored (/public/posters/), how the fallback system works (local -> CDN -> placeholder), and how to update posters when metadata changes.

title: Fix poster field name mismatch in movie store
description: The movie store's getPosterUrl and getPosterUrlSync methods reference metadata.poster (lowercase) but OMDB API returns metadata.Poster (capital P). This causes the fallback logic to fail and not find OMDB poster URLs. The types are correct (Poster with capital P), but the store implementation needs to be updated to match.

title: Centralized Movie Data Scraping System
description: Build a centralized movie data scraping system that collects movies from Archive.org and YouTube channels, stores them in data/movies.json indexed by imdbId, and enriches metadata via OMDB API. This system will provide the foundation for the movies-deluxe platform.

title: Create data directory structure and movies.json schema
description: Create data/ directory with movies.json file. Define schema: flat index by imdbId (e.g., 'tt0012345'), with temporary IDs for unmatched movies (e.g., 'archive-{identifier}', 'youtube-{videoId}'). Each entry should have: imdbId, title, year, sources array (type, identifier, url), metadata object, lastUpdated timestamp.

title: Integrate YouTube data into central movies.json
description: Update YouTube scraper to merge data into data/movies.json. Handle deduplication: if movie exists (by imdbId), add youtube source to sources array; if new, create entry. Store channel-specific metadata. Support multiple videos of same movie from different channels. Include dry-run mode.

title: Configure initial YouTube channel list
description: Create config/youtube-channels.json with initial channels: FilmRise Movies, Popcornflix, Movie Central. Include channel ID/handle, name, language, and notes. Add support for reading this config in scraper. Document how to add new channels. Start with 2-3 English channels, expand later.

title: Create OMDB enrichment script for unmatched movies
description: Create scripts/enrich-omdb.ts to process movies with temporary IDs (archive-*, youtube-*). Attempt OMDB matching with improved strategies: fuzzy matching, alternate titles, manual review mode. Update movies.json with matched imdbIds. Generate report of unmatched movies. Respect rate limits with progress saving.

title: Add data validation and quality checks
description: Create scripts/validate-data.ts to check movies.json integrity: validate imdbId format, check for duplicate entries, verify source URLs, detect missing required fields, find orphaned temporary IDs. Generate validation report with warnings and errors. Add --fix flag to auto-correct issues where possible.

title: Create deduplication utilities
description: Add deduplication logic to dataManager: detect duplicate movies by title similarity, merge entries with same imdbId, consolidate sources from duplicates, handle conflicts (different years, titles). Create scripts/deduplicate.ts for manual deduplication runs. Generate merge reports for review.

title: Update movie store to read from data/movies.json
description: Refactor app/stores/useMovieStore.ts to load movies from data/movies.json instead of fetching from Archive.org API directly. Add methods: loadFromFile(), filterBySource(), searchMovies(). Keep existing OMDB integration for runtime enrichment. Add caching and lazy loading for large datasets.

title: Add scraper CLI commands to package.json
description: Update package.json scripts section with: 'scrape:archive' (run Archive.org scraper), 'scrape:youtube' (run YouTube scraper with channel param), 'scrape:all' (run all scrapers), 'enrich:omdb' (run OMDB enrichment), 'validate:data' (run validation), 'dedupe' (run deduplication). Use tsx to run TypeScript scripts directly.

title: Create AI-powered title extraction script
description: Create scripts/extract-titles-ai.ts that uses an LLM to extract real movie titles from YouTube-style titles (e.g., 'A Christmas Karen | Free Full Holiday Movie | FilmRise Movies' -> 'A Christmas Karen'). Use a prompt from /prompts directory with a movie enthusiast persona who has seen most movies from the last 100 years. Store extracted title in ai.extractedTitle field in the central data structure. This will improve OMDB matching for entries with promotional text in titles.

title: Create prompts directory with movie title extraction prompt
description: Create /prompts directory with a prompt file for title extraction. The prompt should define a movie enthusiast persona who has extensive knowledge of movies from the last 100 years. The prompt should instruct the LLM to extract the actual movie title from promotional YouTube-style titles, removing channel names, promotional text, and metadata while preserving the authentic movie title.

title: Update TypeScript types to include AI metadata
description: Update types/movie.ts to add an 'ai' field to the MovieEntry interface. This field should contain AI-extracted metadata including extractedTitle (the cleaned movie title), confidence score, and timestamp. This allows storing AI-enhanced data alongside the original scraped data.

title: Define TypeScript types for centralized data model
description: Create types/movie.ts with interfaces for: MovieEntry (main data structure), MovieSource (archive.org, youtube, etc.), MovieMetadata (OMDB data), MoviesDatabase (the full movies.json structure). Include utility types for temporary IDs and source-specific data.

title: Update OMDB enrichment to use AI-extracted titles
description: Modify scripts/enrich-omdb.ts to prioritize AI-extracted titles (from ai.extractedTitle field) when searching OMDB. Implement fallback strategy: try AI-extracted title first, then original title if no match found. This improves matching success rate for entries with promotional text or poor quality titles. Add logging to track which title source produced successful matches.

title: Add extract-titles CLI command to package.json
description: Add 'extract-titles' script to package.json that runs the AI title extraction script. This should process all entries in movies.json that don't have ai.extractedTitle yet. Support options for batch processing, rate limiting, and dry-run mode. This script should be run after scraping and before OMDB enrichment for optimal results.

title: Add required scraper dependencies
description: Install dependencies: youtubei (YouTube API client), @types/node (for file system operations), tsx (for running TypeScript scripts). Update package.json with scraper script commands. Consider adding cheerio if HTML parsing is needed.

title: Create shared scraper utilities
description: Create scripts/utils/ directory with: dataManager.ts (load/save movies.json, merge entries, handle locking), omdbMatcher.ts (search OMDB by title/year, match confidence scoring), idGenerator.ts (generate temporary IDs, validate imdbIds), logger.ts (consistent logging across scrapers). Include error handling and retry logic.

title: Build Archive.org scraper script
description: Create scripts/scrape-archive.ts that fetches movies from Archive.org collections (start with feature_films). Use existing fetchArchiveOrgMovies logic as base. Support pagination, configurable row limits, and multiple collections. Extract: title, identifier, year, description, creator, downloads, thumbnail. Generate temporary ID 'archive-{identifier}' for unmatched movies.

title: Implement OMDB matching for Archive.org movies
description: Integrate OMDB API matching into Archive.org scraper. For each movie, attempt to find imdbId by searching with title and year. Use confidence scoring (exact match, fuzzy match, no match). Replace temporary 'archive-{identifier}' ID with imdbId when matched. Respect OMDB rate limits (1000/day free tier). Add --skip-omdb flag for testing.

title: Integrate Archive.org data into central movies.json
description: Update Archive.org scraper to merge data into data/movies.json using dataManager utilities. Handle deduplication: if movie exists, add archive.org to sources array; if new, create entry. Preserve existing metadata and sources from other scrapers. Add lastUpdated timestamp. Include dry-run mode for testing.

title: Build generic YouTube channel scraper
description: Create scripts/scrape-youtube.ts using youtubei library (like youtube-augment.ts). Accept channel ID/handle as parameter. Fetch all videos from channel's uploads playlist. Extract: videoId, title, description, publishedAt, channelName, thumbnails, duration. Support pagination and rate limiting (500ms between requests). Generate temporary ID 'youtube-{videoId}' for unmatched videos.

title: Implement OMDB matching for YouTube videos
description: Add OMDB matching to YouTube scraper. Parse movie title and year from video title (common patterns: 'Movie Title (2020)', 'Movie Title | 2020', etc.). Search OMDB and match with confidence scoring. Handle false positives (trailers, clips, reviews). Replace 'youtube-{videoId}' with imdbId when matched. Add --skip-omdb flag.

title: Set up conventional commits with commitlint and git hooks
